item.title: [ENTESB-4610] Fabric gateway fails because of incorrect use of ShutdownTracker
item.description:

Under load, after some time, one of the gateways stops accepting further requests. The problem is first noticed in an exception handler, although the actual exception is never reported. item.summary: Fabric gateway fails because of incorrect use of ShutdownTracker

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
It appears that the exception raised from the network layer propagates up to the gateway here:

https://github.com/fabric8io/fabric8/blob/1.x/gateway/gateway-core/src/main/java/io/fabric8/gateway/handlers/detecting/DetectingGateway.java#L410

This results in a call to shutdownTracker.release()

private void handleShutdown(ConnectedSocketInfo connectedInfo) {
 
  if( socketsConnected.remove(connectedInfo) ) { 
    connectedInfo.from.close();
 
    connectedInfo.to.close();
 
    shutdownTacker.release();
 
  }
 
}

I wonder if the ShutdownTracker is in the correct state to call release() at this point?
Are they using SSL? And are they on the latest patch level. 6.2.0 shipped with a few known bugs in the gateway that have been patched subsequently. see PATCH-957
Since there is no reproducer I'm kinda shooting in the dark here. My plan is to tighten up the concurrency synchronizations around the shutdown tracker.
Tightened up concurrency change is available at https://github.com/chirino/fabric8/tree/ENTESB-4610

So shutdown tracking is something new that was introduced to help avoid weird error messages that can occur during shutdown due service invocations being perform while a shutdown is in progress. The thought was it would be better to reject new requests with a Shutdown is in progress message than to allow the connection continue to be accepted.

Shutdown tracking relies on reference tracking to see when the service is no longer in use to know that it can be safely shutdown. All subsequent requests to use the the service then raise the shutdown is in progress exception. The root cause of the problem is due to the reference counter dipping to zero before the service is actually shutdown. We still have not determined whats causing the reference counter have this invalid dip.

But in short disabling shutdown tracking should not affect on going operation of the service. It only would have an affect when the service is shutting down. That's why we believe applying the last patch should be safe.

Just chatted with the customer, they would feel better about the io.fabric8.common.util.ShutdownTracker.DISABLED system property patch if it logged messages when the error condition is encountered. I'll apply the change shortly.
Verified that relevant commits are present in 6.3.0.133
